intro: Combretum undulatomarginatum, commonly known as the undulating-margin combretum, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Lythraceae and is characterized by its opposite, ovate to elliptic leaves with undulating margins. The plant produces small, fragrant, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, typically blooming during the dry season. Its fruits are capsules that split open to release small, winged seeds. This species is often found in open woodland and along riverbanks, where it plays a role in local ecosystems.
